content.raw:
cmake test too
~~~
diff -r 4eae408b21de test/cmake/plugin/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/cmake/plugin/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Mar 23 09:51:03 2015 -0700
+++ b/test/cmake/plugin/CMakeLists.txt	Mon Mar 23 09:59:14 2015 -0700
@@ -19,5 +19,6 @@
 
 include_directories(${GAZEBO_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 link_directories(${GAZEBO_LIBRARY_DIRS})
+set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
 add_library(hello_world SHARED ../../testfiles/hello_world.cc)
 target_link_libraries(hello_world ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})
~~~
content.html:
cmake test too

diff -r 4eae408b21de test/cmake/plugin/CMakeLists.txt
--- a/test/cmake/plugin/CMakeLists.txt  Mon Mar 23 09:51:03 2015 -0700
+++ b/test/cmake/plugin/CMakeLists.txt  Mon Mar 23 09:59:14 2015 -0700
@@ -19,5 +19,6 @@

 include_directories(${GAZEBO_INCLUDE_DIRS})
 link_directories(${GAZEBO_LIBRARY_DIRS})
+set(CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS "${CMAKE_CXX_FLAGS} ${GAZEBO_CXX_FLAGS}")
 add_library(hello_world SHARED ../../testfiles/hello_world.cc)
 target_link_libraries(hello_world ${GAZEBO_LIBRARIES} ${Boost_LIBRARIES})

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw:
[I've modified](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/commits/bf6aed1b3007424b73f5bd8ac2f768393a838ae3) the Windows script to install ign-math2.zip. 

However, [this is broken](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/os_windows/job/gazebo-any-devel-windows7-amd64/21/console). When we use the cmake module in Windows (like what we do for sdformat) all is fine when you build sdformat from source. The cmake module is being generated with [***paths*** relative to that compilation](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/83baead60039d607100c9d5a84ca7322c935ca5a/cmake/ignition-math-config.cmake.in?at=default#cl-18) which is not the same as the continuous integration job.

Or we modify the cmake module not to check for the library or we modify the Windows script to build ign-math from source, like what we are doing with sdformat and it is recommended in the README.md.
content.html:
I've modified the Windows script to install ign-math2.zip.

However, this is broken. When we use the cmake module in Windows (like what we do for sdformat) all is fine when you build sdformat from source. The cmake module is being generated with paths relative to that compilation which is not the same as the continuous integration job.

Or we modify the cmake module not to check for the library or we modify the Windows script to build ign-math from source, like what we are doing with sdformat and it is recommended in the README.md.

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: The last option (build ign-math from source in the Windows script) sounds the best.
content.html: The last option (build ign-math from source in the Windows script) sounds the best.

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: Why do we have this forward declaration of `Spline` and `RotationSpline`? Can we `#include` the ign-math headers for these classes?
content.html: Why do we have this forward declaration of Spline and RotationSpline? Can we #include the ign-math headers for these classes?

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: Minimizing `#include`s in header files can reduce compilation time.
content.html: Minimizing #includes in header files can reduce compilation time.

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: Ok. It stuck out to me because we don't do this consistently across header files touched in this commit, and because it's now declaring the classes in a different top-level namespace (ignition instead of Gazebo).
content.html: Ok. It stuck out to me because we don't do this consistently across header files touched in this commit, and because it's now declaring the classes in a different top-level namespace (ignition instead of Gazebo).

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: Forward declarations only work when pointers are used. In other cases, a `#include` is needed.
content.html: Forward declarations only work when pointers are used. In other cases, a #include is needed.

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: It also works in a function declaration as a non-pointer parameter or return value.
content.html: It also works in a function declaration as a non-pointer parameter or return value.

pullrequest.title: First step in transition to ign-math

content.raw: I don't think `find_package(ignition-math2 REQUIRED)` should be necessary, it should be included in the gazebo variables.
content.html: I don't think find_package(ignition-math2 REQUIRED) should be necessary, it should be included in the gazebo variables.

content.html: Almost all of the examples that use pkg-config to find gazebo are being converted to cmake find_package, with the exception of stand_alone/custom_main_pkgconfig. I assume this is going to be a new trend in how we set up these examples?
